001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.authentication;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.exceptions.AuthenticationUiException;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.service.fluent.SuperUiServiceFluent;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.service.fluent.UiServiceFluent;
007import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressFBWarnings;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Optional;
013import java.util.Set;
014import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
015import lombok.Getter;
016import org.openqa.selenium.By;
017import org.openqa.selenium.Cookie;
018import org.openqa.selenium.JavascriptExecutor;
019import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
020import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
021
022/**
023 * Abstract base class for implementing UI-based authentication clients.
024 *
025 * <p>This class provides a mechanism for logging in through a UI service, caching session data,
026 * and restoring sessions using stored cookies and local storage data. Subclasses must implement
027 * the {@link #loginImpl(UiServiceFluent, String, String)} method to define specific login logic.
028 *
029 * <p>The authentication flow consists of:
030 * <ul>
031 *     <li>Performing login through UI interaction.</li>
032 *     <li>Waiting for a successful login indication.</li>
033 *     <li>Caching session cookies and local storage data for reuse.</li>
034 *     <li>Restoring an existing session if caching is enabled.</li>
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
038 */
039public abstract class BaseLoginClient implements LoginClient {
040
041   /**
042    * A thread-safe map to store user sessions based on login credentials.
043    */
044   private static final Map<LoginKey, SessionInfo> userLoginMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
045
046   /**
047    * Keeps track of the {@link SmartWebDriver} instances that are used for copying sessions
048    * to other drivers in order to enable login session caching and bypass repeated logins.
049    *
050    * <p>These drivers are preserved throughout the execution and are closed at the end of the run.
051    */
052   @Getter
053   @SuppressFBWarnings("MS_EXPOSE_REP")
054   private static final List<SmartWebDriver> driverToKeep = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList<>());
055
056   /**
057    * JavaScript command to retrieve local storage data.
058    */
059   private static final String GET_LOCAL_STORAGE = "return JSON.stringify(window.localStorage);";
060
061   /**
062    * JavaScript command to restore local storage data.
063    */
064   private static final String UPDATE_LOCAL_STORAGE =
065         "let data = %s; for (let key in data) { window.localStorage.setItem(key, data[key]); }";
066
067   /**
068    * Stores the URL obtained after a successful login for each session.
069    *
070    * <p>This allows the system to directly navigate to the appropriate URL when session caching is used.
071    * The map key is a {@link LoginKey} containing the username, password, and login type information.
072    */
073   private static final Map<LoginKey, String> urlAfterLoggingMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
074
075
076   /**
077    * Logs in the user and optionally caches session data for reuse.
078    *
079    * @param uiService The UI service used for login interactions.
080    * @param username  The username of the user.
081    * @param password  The password of the user.
082    * @param cache     Whether to cache the session for future reuse.
083    */
084   @Override
085   @SuppressFBWarnings("JLM_JSR166_UTILCONCURRENT_MONITORENTER")
086   public void login(final SuperUiServiceFluent<?> uiService, final String username, final String password,
087                     final boolean cache) {
088      LoginKey loginKey = new LoginKey(username, password, this.getClass());
089
090      if (!cache) {
091         performLoginAndCache(uiService, loginKey, username, password);
092      } else {
093         synchronized (userLoginMap) {
094            if (userLoginMap.get(loginKey) == null) {
095               performLoginAndCache(uiService, loginKey, username, password);
096            } else {
097               restoreSession(uiService, userLoginMap.get(loginKey), urlAfterLoggingMap.get(loginKey));
098            }
099         }
100      }
101   }
102
103
104   /**
105    * Retrieves cached authentication session info if available.
106    *
107    * @param loginKey The key representing the login credentials.
108    * @return An {@link Optional} containing the session information if found.
109    */
110   public Optional<SessionInfo> getAuthentication(final LoginKey loginKey) {
111      return Optional.ofNullable(userLoginMap.get(loginKey));
112   }
113
114
115   /**
116    * Performs login and caches session cookies and local storage data.
117    *
118    * @param uiService The UI service used for login interactions.
119    * @param loginKey  The key representing the login credentials.
120    * @param username  The username of the user.
121    * @param password  The password of the user.
122    */
123   private void performLoginAndCache(SuperUiServiceFluent<?> uiService, LoginKey loginKey, String username,
124                                     String password) {
125      loginImpl(uiService, username, password);
126      SmartWebDriver smartWebDriver = uiService.getDriver();
127      smartWebDriver.setKeepDriverForSession(true);
128      driverToKeep.add(smartWebDriver);
129
130      try {
131         smartWebDriver.getWait()
132               .until(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(successfulLoginElementLocator()));
133      } catch (Exception e) {
134         throw new AuthenticationUiException("Logging in was not successful", e);
135      }
136
137      urlAfterLoggingMap.put(loginKey, smartWebDriver.getCurrentUrl());
138
139      WebDriver driver = smartWebDriver.getOriginal();
140      Set<Cookie> cookies = driver.manage().getCookies();
141      String localStorage = executeJavaScript(driver, GET_LOCAL_STORAGE);
142
143      userLoginMap.put(loginKey, new SessionInfo(cookies, localStorage));
144   }
145
146
147   /**
148    * Restores a previously cached session by injecting cookies and local storage data.
149    *
150    * @param uiService   The UI service used for browser interactions.
151    * @param sessionInfo The stored session information.
152    */
153   private void restoreSession(SuperUiServiceFluent<?> uiService, SessionInfo sessionInfo, String urlAfterLogging) {
154      SmartWebDriver smartWebDriver = uiService.getDriver();
155      WebDriver driver = smartWebDriver.getOriginal();
156
157      try {
158         smartWebDriver.get(urlAfterLogging);
159
160         smartWebDriver.manage().deleteAllCookies();
161
162         sessionInfo.getCookies().forEach(cookie -> driver.manage().addCookie(cookie));
163
164         executeJavaScript(driver, String.format(UPDATE_LOCAL_STORAGE, sessionInfo.getLocalStorage()));
165
166         smartWebDriver.get(urlAfterLogging);
167      } catch (Exception e) {
168         throw new AuthenticationUiException("Restoring session was not successful", e);
169      }
170
171
172      try {
173         smartWebDriver.getWait()
174               .until(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(successfulLoginElementLocator()));
175      } catch (Exception e) {
176         throw new AuthenticationUiException("Logging in was not successful", e);
177      }
178   }
179
180
181   /**
182    * Executes JavaScript in the browser.
183    *
184    * @param driver The WebDriver instance.
185    * @param script The JavaScript command to execute.
186    * @return The result of the JavaScript execution.
187    */
188   private String executeJavaScript(WebDriver driver, String script) {
189      if (driver instanceof JavascriptExecutor jsExecutor) {
190         return (String) jsExecutor.executeScript(script);
191      } else {
192         throw new IllegalStateException("Driver does not support JavaScript execution");
193      }
194   }
195
196
197   /**
198    * Performs the actual login operation.
199    *
200    * <p>This method should be implemented by subclasses to define the specific UI interactions
201    * required to log in.
202    *
203    * @param uiService The UI service for interacting with the login page.
204    * @param username  The username for authentication.
205    * @param password  The password for authentication.
206    * @param <T>       The type of UI service being used.
207    */
208   protected abstract <T extends UiServiceFluent<?>> void loginImpl(T uiService, String username, String password);
209
210   /**
211    * Provides the locator for an element that indicates a successful login.
212    *
213    * <p>This method should return a {@link By} locator that identifies an element that only
214    * appears after a successful login, such as a dashboard or a user profile menu.
215    *
216    * @return A Selenium {@link By} locator for the post-login verification element.
217    */
218   protected abstract By successfulLoginElementLocator();
219
220}
